Contributors:


Tony Auld, Russell Barrett, Timothy Brodribb, Brendan Choat, David Coleman, Félix de Tombeur, Lily Dun, David Ellsworth, Rachael Gallagher, Carl Gosper, Lydia Guja, Gregory J. Jordan, Tom Le Breton, Andy Leigh, Patricia Lu-Irving, Belinda Medlyn, Rachael Nolan, Mark Ooi, Karen D. Sommerville, Ruby Stephens, Peter Vesk, Matthew White, Ian J. Wright, Sophie Yang

title: The AusTraits Plant Dictionary (APD) Ontology
text:
plant trait











Property


Value







URI


https://w3id.org/APD/traits/trait_group_0000000




label


plant trait




description


A measurable or observable characteristic of a cellular component [GO:0005575], biological process [GO:0008150] or molecular function [GO:0003674] that is part of, or has participant a plant anatomical entity [PO:0025131] and/or a plant structure development stage [PO:0009012]. This includes physiological, molecular and biochemical traits as well.




has narrower



biochemical trait
plant morphology trait
biological process trait, physiological process trait
life history trait




NA






is in scheme


https://w3id.org/APD/traits




identifier


trait_group_0000000

title: The AusTraits Plant Dictionary (APD) Ontology
text:
biochemical trait











Property


Value







URI


https://w3id.org/APD/traits/trait_group_0000002




label


biochemical trait




description


A plant trait [TO:0000387] which is a quality of a chemical entity [CHEBI:24431], a plant metabolite [CHEBI:76924], or a molecular function [GO:0003674], which occurs in a cellular component [GO:0005575], plant anatomical entity [PO:0025131] or during a plant structure development stage [PO:0009012].




has narrower



mineral and ion content trait
metabolite content trait
stable isotope ratio determination




has broader


plant trait




is in scheme


https://w3id.org/APD/traits




identifier


trait_group_0000002

title: The AusTraits Plant Dictionary (APD) Ontology
text:
mineral and ion content trait











Property


Value







URI


https://w3id.org/APD/traits/trait_group_0000004




label


mineral and ion content trait




description


A biochemical trait [TO:0000277] that is the amount of a particular mineral or ion constituent occurring in a plant anatomical entity [PO:0025131].




has narrower



leaf mineral and ion content trait
stem mineral and ion content trait
bark mineral and ion content trait
root mineral and ion content trait
reproductive shoot system mineral and ion content trait
cell or tissue mineral and ion content trait




has broader


biochemical trait




is in scheme


https://w3id.org/APD/traits




identifier


trait_group_0000004

stable isotope ratio determination











Property


Value







URI


https://w3id.org/APD/traits/trait_group_0003004




label


stable isotope ratio determination




description


A mineral and ion content trait [TO:0000465] which is a ratio [PATO:0001470] of two naturally occurring stable isotopes [EnvThes:20310], generally expressed in delta notation.

Leaf stable carbon isotope composition (delta13C
Stem stable carbon isotope composition (delta13C
Root stable carbon isotope composition (delta13C

title: The AusTraits Plant Dictionary (APD) Ontology
text:
plant morphology trait











Property


Value







URI


https://w3id.org/APD/traits/trait_group_0010001




label


plant morphology trait




description


A plant trait [TO:0000387] which is a morphological quality of a plant anatomical entity [PO:0025131] or a constituent cellular component [GO:0005575] contained therein. Includes traits of plant structures [PO:0009011] such as plant cell [PO:0009002], plant organ [PO:0009008], portion of plant tissue [PO:0009007], vascular system [PO:0000034], whole plant [PO:0000003] and seed [PO:0009010], as well as those of plant anatomical spaces [PO:0025117] and portions of plant substance [PO:0025161].




has narrower



whole plant morphology trait
plant structure morphology trait
vascular tissue morphology trait
plant structure strength trait




has broader


plant trait




is in scheme


https://w3id.org/APD/traits




identifier
